subsc: Water supply,Crops,Central government administration,Other industry,General industry and trade sector
trustfund:
TF039647-CHAD - STRATEGY FOR COTTON
            SECTOR REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project aims at restoring critical public sector capacity,
            driving expenditures towards priority development areas and
            facilitate privatization. The objectives include the
            preparation of civil service reforms and a continued effort
            for improving government revenues, with a focus on public
            expenditures, prioritizing on education and health sectors.
            Public enterprise reforms are also considered, mainly in the
            infrastructure sectors. The Project will benefit the
            country's development strategy, with a strong growth
            performance, thus contributing to poverty alleviation.
            Increased public services in the social and infrastructure
            sectors, as well as the enhancement of the rule of law, will
            support economic stabilization and contribute to the private
            sector development. However, several risks are foreseen. On
            the political front, despite the reconciliation process,
            unrest and military challenges are risks to be considered;
            on the social front, risks due to the opposition of
            influential civil service unions still exist; and,
            weaknesses on the implementation capacity front, could
            hinder the program. Reliability on the Capacity Building for
            Economic Management Project will mitigate this risk.
